name: impenetrability
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being impossible to see through or go through: impenetrability of It's hard to get access to most of the animals because of the impenetrability of the habitat. Until 1953, Everest's summit had an aura of impenetrability.
the quality of being impossible to understand: impenetrability of The impenetrability of the plot, and the large cast of characters can be frustrating. The impenetrability of much research is a cause for some concern.
More examplesFewer examplesOne exception to the impenetrability of the drug companies is the access that a few politicians have enjoyed. A key channel of investor communications is still the annual report, famous for its impenetrability.
